answers.answer: I'm going to PM a name to you from gimel's list.Even with a referral, it's always best to interview them over the phone before making an appointment.  You'll probably have to speak to a nurse (once the receptionist determines she has no clue what you're talking about).  You can ask which tests the doctor typically orders for hypo patients and which meds they are amenable to prescribing.  I'd also ask how much of their practice is devoted to thyroid (you don't necessarily want to see a diabetes specialist).  When I was looking for an endo, I made up a multiple choice questionnaire (so they could fill it out in about a minute) and faxed it to all the endos in the area in my health plan.

question: Hello Everyone,I am looking for a good doctor who specializes in autoimmune thyroid problems in the Boston area, and is willing to check Free T3+FreeT4+TSH and prescribe Armour thyroid (or other T3 + T4 meds) when needed. I have a strong preference for doctors who don't work at MGH. Thank you in advance.
title: Looking for a thyroid doctor in the Boston area
